title: When did Alternate point of view become a thing in writing fiction? - Quora

response.answer_text: I suppose one could at least assert with some confidence as early as the mid-14th century, in Boccaccio’s Decameron, but it seem reasonable to conclude that there may have been earlier, less notable attempts in the Middle Ages now obscure to history, and some classical works I’m just overlooking (one might be tempted to suggest Plato as a candidate, for example, though I would argue against this: his writing was not correctly “fiction”, though it was clearly fictive in many of its elements).
